summary: The Forest Service Accountability Act amends the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994. It mandates that the President, with Senate advice and consent, appoint the Chief of the Forest Service. The bill outlines qualifications for the Chief, including experience in forest and natural resources management.  It also specifies that nominations for the Chief undergo joint referral to the Senate Committees on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry, and Energy and Natural Resources.  The bill includes provisions regarding the application of the new law to currently serving individuals.
